  • Champurrado

    Ingredients:

    • 3 cups of water
    • 2 cinnamon sticks
    • ¼ cup masa (mexican corn dough)
    • 2 cups milk
    • Half disk mexican chocolate (like abuelita chocolate) chopped
    • 1/2 cup brown sugar

    Roberto's champurrado

    Servings:

    6

    Time:

    30 minutes

    Directions:

    Champurrado is a thick Mexican chocolate and cornflour hot drink.

    Boil the water and cinnamon for a good 5 minutes, then let sit and cool for 30 mins or so. Remove the cinnamon from water, and heat water at low/medium-low heat. As water heats, add the masa slowly and mix gently to make a thick, uniform liquid. Then add the milk, chocolate, and brown sugar--and mix. Keep in medium heat and whisk until chocolate and sugar dissolve. Serve hot!
